security_audit.summary: All 108 static findings are false positives. The scanner detected markdown code formatting syntax (backticks) as shell execution, hash values as cryptographic usage, and marketing terminology as security keywords. Both Python scripts (brand_voice_analyzer.py, seo_optimizer.py) perform local text analysis using only standard library modules (re, json, typing) with no network access, no external commands, and no cryptographic operations. The skill is a legitimate content marketing tool with no malicious functionality.

content.user_title: Create SEO-Optimized Content with Brand Voice Analysis
content.value_statement: Marketing teams struggle to maintain consistent brand voice while optimizing content for search engines. This skill provides automated brand voice analysis, SEO scoring, and platform-specific content frameworks to create professional marketing content faster.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes brand voice characteristics including formality, tone, perspective, and readability using the Flesch Reading Ease formula
Evaluates SEO optimization with keyword density analysis, structure assessment, meta tag suggestions, and actionable recommendations
Provides 15+ content templates for blog posts, social media, email campaigns, case studies, and video scripts
Includes platform-specific guidelines for LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok optimization
Generates content calendars with monthly planning templates and performance tracking frameworks
limitations: Does not generate content - analyzes and optimizes existing drafts
Does not access external data or APIs for keyword research
Does not publish or schedule content on any platform
Does not perform competitor analysis or market research

use_cases.title: Maintain Brand Consistency
use_cases.description: Analyze all content drafts against brand voice guidelines before publication to ensure consistent messaging across channels.

use_cases.title: Optimize Blog Posts
use_cases.description: Run SEO analysis on drafts to improve keyword placement, structure, and readability scores before submitting for review.

use_cases.title: Create Platform-Optimized Posts
use_cases.description: Use platform-specific templates and guidelines to adapt content for LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok.

prompt_templates.title: Brand Voice Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brand_voice_analyzer to check [file.md] for formality level, tone consistency, and readability score. Report findings and recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: SEO Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run seo_optimizer.py on [article.md] with primary keyword '[keyword]' and secondary keywords '[kw1, kw2]'. Apply all recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Social Post Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create LinkedIn and Twitter versions of [blog-post.md] using the templates in references/content_frameworks.md. Follow platform guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Content Calendar
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a monthly content calendar template based on the 40/25/25/10 content pillar ratio from references/content_frameworks.md for [topic/industry].

output_examples.input: Analyze my blog post draft for brand voice consistency and provide specific improvement suggestions.
output: Formality Score: 72/100 (Semi-formal, appropriate for B2B audience)
Tone: Professional with conversational elements - consistent throughout
Readability: 68 (College level) - consider simplifying for broader audience
Recommendations: Reduce sentence length in section 3, add more 2nd person perspective

output_examples.input: Check my article for SEO optimization targeting 'remote work productivity' as primary keyword.
output: SEO Score: 74/100 - Good foundation with room for improvement
Missing: Add keyword to H2 heading, include in first paragraph
Structure: 3 H2s, 2 H3s, good hierarchy - add 2 internal links
Meta Description: Generate suggested title and description for SERP optimization

output_examples.input: Create a content calendar for next month focusing on sustainability marketing.
output: Monthly Goals Template: Traffic, Lead Generation, Engagement, Key Campaign
Week 1 Plan: Blog post on sustainability tips, LinkedIn article share
Week 2 Plan: Instagram carousel on eco-friendly practices, Email newsletter
Week 3 Plan: Twitter thread on sustainability statistics, Blog post deep-dive
Content Mix: 40% educational, 25% promotional, 25% engagement, 10% curated

best_practices: Run brand voice analysis on existing top-performing content to establish your baseline voice profile before creating new content
Apply SEO optimization after drafting content, not during, to maintain natural flow while still achieving optimization goals
Use content frameworks as starting templates and adapt them to your brand voice rather than following them rigidly
anti_patterns: Do not rely solely on automated analysis - always apply human judgment for brand voice authenticity
Do not over-optimize for SEO by stuffing keywords or forcing unnatural phrasing that damages readability
Do not use the same content across all platforms without adapting for platform-specific best practices

faq.question: What does the brand voice analyzer measure?
faq.answer: It measures formality level, tone attributes (professional, friendly, authoritative), perspective (1st/2nd/3rd person), and readability using Flesch Reading Ease.

faq.question: How does the SEO optimizer calculate scores?
faq.answer: It scores content on keyword density (1-3% optimal), placement in title and first paragraph, heading structure, internal/external links, and readability.

faq.question: Can this skill create content for me?
faq.answer: No, this skill analyzes and optimizes existing content. For content generation, use a writing-focused skill alongside this one.

faq.question: Which social media platforms are supported?
faq.answer: LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok with platform-specific templates, optimal lengths, and hashtag guidelines.

faq.question: Does the skill access external APIs?
faq.answer: No, all analysis runs locally using Python standard library. No network calls are made for keyword research or content optimization.

faq.question: How often should I run SEO analysis?
faq.answer: Run SEO analysis on every content piece before publishing, and re-check after making revisions to ensure improvements are maintained.
